info.title: SystemLink DataFrame Service
info.description: API for creating new tables, append rows to tables, and read rows from the tables. Rows are encoded as data frames.

get.summary: Get rows of data from the specified table
get.description: Reads raw data from the table identified by its ID. For more advanced filtering and ordering, use the `POST /v1/tables/{id}/query-data` route.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of a DataFrame table.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of the names of columns to include in the response. The response
            will include the columns in the same order specified in this parameter. All columns are included in the order
            specified at table creation if this property is excluded.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of the names of columns to order the results by. Multiple columns may be specified to order rows that have the same value for prior columns.
            The columns used for ordering do not need to be included in the `columns` list, in which case they are not returned in the response.
            If orderBy is not specified, then the order in which results are returned is undefined.

parameters.name: orderByDescending
parameters.description:
Whether to order descending instead of ascending. If orderBy is specified, then elements in the response
            are ordered ascending by default. The orderByDescending value must be a boolean string. The elements in the response are ordered ascending if false
            and descending if true.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description:
Limits the returned list to the specified number of results. Use with the `continuationToken` property
            to implement pagination.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description:
A token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching results. When
querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued. To obtain the next page of results,
pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation
token. To paginate results, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided
by the service, until this value is null.

post.summary: Append one or more rows of data to the table identified by its ID
post.description:
Multiple data formats are supported, distinguished by the `Content-Type` header
of the request:


- `application/json`: Each row of data must contain a value for each non-nullable column
in the table, in a format that can be converted to the column's datatype. Any nullable
columns not included in `data` will receive a null value for each appended row. `endOfData`
is provided in the request body.


- `application/vnd.apache.arrow.stream`: [Apache Arrow IPC Streaming](https://www.ni.com/r/arrow-ipc-format)
binary format. The data must contain a column for each non-nullable column in the table
using data types compatible with the column's datatype. Any nullable columns not included
in the request will receive a null value for each appended row. Timestamp values are
truncated to milliseconds, even when using nanosecond or microsecond units. `endOfData`
is provided as a query parameter. Added in version 2 of the `writeData` operation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of a DataFrame table.

parameters.name: endOfData
parameters.description:
Whether the table should expect any additional rows to be appended in future requests.
Not valid for JSON requests; use the `endOfData` property in the request body instead.
Added in version 2 of the `writeData` operation.

409.description: The table does not support appending additional rows.

429.description: The service is processing too many requests.

post.summary: Query for rows of data with ordering and filtering
post.description:
Reads rows of data that match a filter from the table identified by its ID.


Use the `columns` property to return a subset of each row.


Use the `filters` property to filter the returned rows.


Use the `orderBy` and `filters` properties to order and filter the returned rows.


Use the `take` and `continuationToken` properties to return paged responses.


For more requests that don't require filtering, use the `GET /v1/tables/{id}/data` route.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of a DataFrame table.

post.summary: Export data with sorting and filtering
post.description:
Exports rows of data that match a filter from the table identified by its ID.


Use the `columns` property to return a subset of each row.


Use the `orderBy` and `filters` properties to order and filter the returned rows.


Use the `take` property to limit the number of rows returned.


Use the `responseFormat` property to select the format of the exported content. The only response format currently supported is `CSV`.


Added in version 2 of the `readData` operation. The `take` property was added in version 3 of the `readData` operation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of a DataFrame table.

post.summary: Query for rows of decimated data with filtering
post.description:
Reads rows of data that match a filter from the table identified by its ID.


Use the `columns` property to return a subset of each row.


Use the `filters` property to filter the returned rows.


Use the `decimation` property to specify parameters on how data will be decimated.


For more requests that don't require data decimation, use the `POST /v1/tables/{id}/query-data` route.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of a DataFrame table.

get.description:
Lists available tables on the SystemLink DataFrame service.


Use the `take` and `continuationToken` parameters to return paged responses.


The `orderBy` and `orderByDescending` parameters can be used to manage sorting the list by metadata objects.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Limits the returned list to the specified number of results.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of table IDs

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
The sort order of the returned list of tables. By default, tables are sorted in ascending order based on the specified value:

- CREATED_AT: The date and time the table was created (default oldest table first).

- METADATA_MODIFIED_AT: The date and time the table's metadata properties were modified.

- NAME: The table's name, which defaults to the table's ID if a name is not provided.

- NUMBER_OF_ROWS: The number of rows of data in the table (default least number of rows first).

- ROWS_MODIFIED_AT: Date and time rows were most recently appended to the table.

schema.description:
- CREATED_AT: The date and time the table was created (default oldest table first).

- METADATA_MODIFIED_AT: The date and time the table's metadata properties were modified.

- NAME: The table's name, which defaults to the table's ID if a name is not provided.

- NUMBER_OF_ROWS: The number of rows of data in the table (default least number of rows first).

- ROWS_MODIFIED_AT: Date and time rows were most recently appended to the table.

parameters.name: orderByDescending
parameters.description:
Whether to sort descending instead of ascending. The elements in the list are sorted ascending by default.
If the orderByDescending parameter is specified, the elements in the list are sorted based on it's value.
The orderByDescending value must be a boolean string. The elements in the list are sorted ascending if false
and descending if true.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description:
A token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching results. When
querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued. To obtain the next page of results,
pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation
token. To paginate results, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided
by the service, until this value is null.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of workspace IDs

post.description: Create a new table with the provided metadata and column definitions.

Queries available tables on the SystemLink DataFrame service and returns the table metadata.


Use the `take` and `continuationToken` properties to return paged responses.


The `orderBy` and `orderByDescending` properties can be used to manage sorting the list by metadata objects.

requestBody.description: The parameters for querying the tables.

get.summary: Get table metadata and column info
get.description: Retrieves the metadata and column information for a single table identified by its ID. This route does not return row data.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of a DataFrame table.

patch.description: Modify the properties associated with the table or columns of the table identified by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of a DataFrame table.

requestBody.description: Contains the metadata properties to modify. Values not included in the request body will remain unchanged.

delete.description: Deletes the table identified by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of a DataFrame table.

post.description: Deletes tables identified by their IDs.

200.description: Partial success: one or more tables could not be deleted

204.description: No content: all tables were successfully deleted

post.summary: Modify metadata of one or more tables
post.description: Modify the properties associated with the tables identified by their IDs.

requestBody.description: Contains the table modifications to apply.

200.description: Partial success: one or more tables could not be modified

204.description: No content: all tables were successfully modified

get.description: Returns information about API versions and available operations.
Returns available operations for a single version of the API.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the API to retrieve operations.

AppendTableDataRequest.title: Append Table Data Request

endOfData.description: Whether the table should expect any additional rows to be appended in future requests.

AppendTableDataRequest.description:
Contains the rows to append and optional flags. The `frame` property is
required unless `endOfData` is true.

AvailableV1Operations.title: Available V1 Operations
AvailableV1Operations.description:
Available operations in the v1 version of the API:


- createTables: The ability to create new DataFrame tables.


- deleteTables: The ability to delete tables and all of their data.


- modifyMetadata: The ability to modify metadata for tables.


- listTables: The ability to locate and read metadata for tables.


- readData: The ability to query and read data from tables.


- writeData: The ability to append rows of data to tables.

ColumnMetadataPatch.title: Column Metadata Patch

properties.description:
The properties to modify. A map of key value properties containing the metadata to be added or
modified. Set a property value to `null` to delete that property.

ColumnMetadataPatch.description: Specifies column properties to add, modify, or delete when editing table metadata.

CreateTableColumn.title: Create Table Column

name.description: The column name, which must be unique across all columns within a single table.

dataType.description:
The column datatype:

- INT32: 32-bit signed integers.

- BOOL: Boolean true or false.

- INT64: 64-bit signed integers.

- FLOAT32: 32-bit IEEE 754 floating-point number.

- FLOAT64: 64-bit IEEE 754 floating-point number.

- STRING: Arbitrary string data.

- TIMESTAMP: Date and time represented in UTC with millisecond precision.

columnType.description:
Specifies a specialized type of column:

- NORMAL: The column has no special properties. This is the default behavior.

- INDEX: The column provides a unique value per row. Each table must provide exactly one INDEX column.
The column's `dataType` must be `INT32`, `INT64`, or `TIMESTAMP`.

- NULLABLE: Rows may contain `null` values for this column. When appending rows, NULLABLE columns may be left out entirely,
in which case all rows being appended will use `null` values for that column.

CreateTableColumn.description: Defines a single column when creating a table.

CreateTableRequest.title: Create Table Request

columns.description: The tables's column definitions. Exactly one column must have a `columnType` of `INDEX`.

name.description: The name to associate with the table. When not specified, a name will be assigned from the table's ID.

properties.description: The properties to set. A map of key value properties containing the metadata to be attached.

testResultId.description:
The ID of the test result associated with the table. A null or empty string indicates
there is no associated test result. Added in version 2 of the `createTables` operation.

workspace.description: This is an optional value. When specified, the workspace the table will be created in. Uses Default workspace if not specified.

CreateTableRequest.description: The tables's column definitions and metadata. Exactly one column must have a `columnType` of `INDEX`.

CreatedResponse.title: Created Response

id.description: The ID of the created table.

CreatedResponse.description: Response for successfully creating a table.

DataFrame.title: Data Frame

columns.description: The names and order of the columns included in the data frame.

data.description:
The data for each row with the order specified in the columns property.
Must contain a value for each column in the columns property.

DataFrame.description:
Data read from or to be written to a table. Values may be `null` (if the column is of type
`NULLABLE`) or encoded as a string in a format according to each column's datatype:
            
- BOOL: One of `"true"` or `"false"`, case-insensitive.
            
- INT32: Any integer number in the range [-2147483648, 2147483647], surrounded by quotes.
            
- INT64: Any integer number in the range [-9223372036854775808, 9223372036854775807], surrounded by quotes.
            
- FLOAT32: A decimal number using a period for the decimal point, optionally in scientific
notation, in the range [-3.40282347E+38, 3.40282347E+38], surrounded by quotes. Not all values
within the range can be represented with 32 bits. To preserve the exact binary encoding of
the value when converting to a string, clients should serialize 9 digits after the decimal.
Instead of a number, the value may be `"NaN"` (not a number), `"Infinity"` (positive infinity),
or `"-Infinity"` (negative infinity), case-sensitive.
            
- FLOAT64: A decimal number using a period for the decimal point, optionally in scientific
notation, in the range [-1.7976931348623157E+308, 1.7976931348623157E+308], surrounded by quotes.
Not all values within the range can be represented with 64 bits. To preserve the exact binary
encoding of the value when converting to a string, clients should serialize 17 digits after the
decimal. Instead of a number, the value may be `"NaN"` (not a number), `"Infinity"` (positive
infinity), or `"-Infinity"` (negative infinity), case-sensitive.
            
- STRING: Any quoted string, escaped as required by JSON.
            
- TIMESTAMP: A date and time with millisecond precision in ISO-8601 format and time zone.
For example: `"2022-08-19T16:17:30.123Z"`. If a time zone is not provided, UTC is assumed.
If a time zone other than UTC is provided, the value will be converted to UTC. If more than
three digits of fractional seconds are provided, the time will be truncated to three digits
(i.e. milliseconds).
            
The format is the same as a serialized Pandas DataFrame with `orient="split"` and `index=False`.
See https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.to_json.html.
            
When providing a DataFrame for appending rows, any of the table's columns not
specified `columns` will receive a value of `null`. If any such columns aren't
nullable, an error will be returned. If the entire `columns` property is left
out, each row is assumed to contain all columns in the order specified when the
table was created. When specified, the `columns` property must appear in the JSON
before the `data` property.

DataFrameQueryResponse.title: Data Frame Query Response

totalRowCount.description: The total number of rows matched by the query across all pages of results.

continuationToken.description:
A token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching results. When
querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued. To obtain the next page of results,
pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation
token. To paginate results, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided
by the service, until this value is null.

DataFrameQueryResponse.description: Contains the result of a query for rows of data.

DecimatedDataFrameQueryResponse.title: Decimated Data Frame Query Response
DecimatedDataFrameQueryResponse.description: Contains the result of a query for rows of decimated data.

DeleteTablesPartialSuccessResponse.title: Delete Tables Partial Success

deletedTableIds.description: The IDs of the tables that were successfully deleted.

failedTableIds.description: The IDs of the tables that could not be deleted.

DeleteTablesPartialSuccessResponse.description:
Contains the result of deleting multiple tables when one or more tables
could not be deleted.

ids.description: The IDs of the tables to delete.

HttpColumn.title: Column

name.description: The column name, which is unique across all columns within a single table.

dataType.description:
The column datatype:

- INT32: 32-bit signed integers.

- BOOL: Boolean true or false.

- INT64: 64-bit signed integers.

- FLOAT32: 32-bit IEEE 754 floating-point number.

- FLOAT64: 64-bit IEEE 754 floating-point number.

- STRING: Arbitrary string data.

- TIMESTAMP: Date and time represented in UTC with millisecond precision.

columnType.description:
Specifies a specialized type of column:

- NORMAL: The column has no special properties. This is the default behavior.

- INDEX: The column provides a unique value per row. Each table must provide exactly one INDEX column.
The column's `dataType` must be `INT32`, `INT64`, or `TIMESTAMP`.

- NULLABLE: Rows may contain `null` values for this column. When appending rows, NULLABLE columns may be left out entirely,
in which case all rows being appended will use `null` values for that column.

HttpColumn.description:
Defines a single column in a table. Fields are required unless a projection is specified
in the request.

message.example: A table with id '4afb2ce3741fe11d88838cc9' was not found or you don't have permission to perform the requested operation on it.

resourceType.description: Type of resource associated with the error

resourceId.description: Identifier of the resource associated with the error

args.description: Positional argument values for the error code

innerErrors.description: Inner errors when the top-level error represents more than one error

example.name: Skyline.OneOrMoreErrorsOccurred
example.message: One or more errors occurred. See the contained list for details of each error.

innerErrors.name: DataFrame.TableNotFoundOrNoAccess
innerErrors.message: A table with id '4afb2ce3741fe11d88838cc9' was not found or you don't have permission to perform the requested operation on it.

HttpTableMetadata.title: Table Metadata

columnCount.description:
The number of columns in the table. This field is only present when a projection
containing `COLUMN_COUNT` is specified in the request.

columns.description: The list of columns in the table.

createdAt.description: The date and time the table was created.

metadataModifiedAt.description: The date and time the table's metadata was last modified.

metadataRevision.description:
The table's metadata revision number. When a table is created, the revision number starts at 1.
Every time metadata is modified, the revision number is incremented by 1.

name.description: The name associated with the table.

rowCount.description: The number of rows in the table.

rowsModifiedAt.description: The date and time the table's data was last modified.

supportsAppend.description:
Whether the table supports appending additional rows of data. Clients may pass an `endOfData`
flag when appending rows to mark all data received.

testResultId.description:
The ID of the test result associated with the table. Responses do not include this
field when there is no associated test result. Added in version 2 of the `listTables`
operation.

workspace.description: The workspace the table belongs to.

HttpTableMetadata.description:
Contains information about a table, including its properties and column definitions. Each
table must provide exactly one column with `columnType` of `INDEX`. All fields except
`columnCount` and `testResultId` are required, unless a projection is specified in the
request.

ListTablesResponse.title: List Tables Response

tables.description: The list of tables returned by the query.

continuationToken.description:
A token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching results. When
querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.To obtain the next page of results,
pass the token to the service on a subsequent request.The service will respond with a new continuation
token.To paginate results, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided
by the service, until this value is null.

ListTablesResponse.description: The response for a table query containing the matched tables.

ModifyTableRequest.title: Modify Table Request

metadataRevision.description:
When specified, this is an integer that must match the last known revision number of the table,
incremented by one. If it doesn't match the current `metadataRevision` incremented by one at the
time of execution, the modify request will be rejected with a 409 Conflict. This is used to
ensure that changes to this table's metadata are based on a known, previous state.

name.description: The new name of the table. Set to `null` to reset the name to the table's ID.

testResultId.description:
The new test result ID associated with the table. Set to `null` or an empty string to
remove the test result ID. Added in version 2 of the `modifyMetadata` operation.

workspace.description:
The new workspace for the table. Set to `null` to reset to the default workspace.
Changing the workspace requires permission to delete the table in its current workspace
and permission to create the table in its new workspace.

properties.description:
The properties to modify. A map of key value properties containing the metadata to be added or
modified. Set a property value to `null` to delete that property.

columns.description: Updates to the column properties. Cannot add or remove columns, or change the name of a column.

ModifyTableRequest.description: Contains the metadata properties to modify. Values not included in the request body will remain unchanged.

ModifyTablesPartialSuccessResponse.title: Modify Tables Partial Success

modifiedTableIds.description: The IDs of the tables that were successfully modified.

failedModifications.description: The requested modifications that could not be applied.

ModifyTablesPartialSuccessResponse.description:
Contains the result of modifying multiple tables when one or more tables
could not be modified.

ModifyTablesRequest.title: Modify Tables Request

tables.description: The table modifications to apply. Each table may only appear in the list once.

replace.description: When `true`, existing properties are replaced instead of merged.

ModifyTablesRequest.description: Contains one or more table modifications to apply.

available.description: Whether the operation is available to the caller (e.g. due to permissions).

version.description: The version of the available operation.

Operation.description:
An operation provided by the API. Each route functionality is covered by an operation.
As new functionality is added to an operation, the `version` is incremented.

QueryTablesRequest.title: Query Tables Request

filter.description:
The table query filter in [Dynamic Linq](https://github.com/ni/systemlink-OpenAPI-documents/wiki/Dynamic-Linq-Query-Language).
Allowed properties in the filter are:


- `columns`: List of columns in the table (see below)


- `createdAt`: DateTime the table was created


- `createdWithin`: TimeSpan in which the table was created


- `id`: String value uniquely identifying the table


- `name`: String name for the table


- `metadataModifiedAt`: DateTime the table's metadata was last modified


- `metadataModifiedWithin`: TimeSpan in which the table's metadata was last modified


- `properties`: Dictionary with string keys and values representing table metadata


- `rowsModifiedAt`: DateTime rows were last appended to the table


- `rowsModifiedWithin`: TimeSpan within rows were last appended to the table


- `rowCount`: Int32 number of rows in the table


- `supportsAppend`: Boolean indicating whether or not the table supports appending additional rows of data


- `testResultId`: String ID of the test result associated with the table


- `workspace`: String ID of the workspace the table belongs to


- `workspaceName`: String name of the workspace the table belongs to


            
Allowed properties in the `columns` list are:


- `name`: String name of the column (requires a `testResultId` filter)


            
Allowed constants in the filter are:


- `RelativeTime.CurrentDay`: TimeSpan representing the elapsed time between now and the start of the current day


- `RelativeTime.CurrentWeek`: TimeSpan representing the elapsed time between now and the start of the current week


- `RelativeTime.CurrentMonth`: TimeSpan representing the elapsed time between now and the start of the current month


- `RelativeTime.CurrentYear`: TimeSpan representing the elapsed time between now and the start of the current year

substitutions.description:
Makes substitutions in the query filter expression. Substitutions for the query expression are indicated
by non-negative integers that are prefixed with the `@` symbol. Each substitution in the given expression
will be replaced by the element at the corresponding index (zero-based) in this list. For example,
`@0` in the filter expression will be replaced with the element at the zeroth index of the substitutions list.

referenceTime.description:
The date and time to use as the reference point for `RelativeTime` filters, including time zone information.
Defaults to the current time in UTC.

items.description:
The fields that may be selected for table metadata projections:

- COLUMN_COUNT: Selects the `ColumnCount` field.

- COLUMN_NAME: Selects the `Name` field of each element of the `Columns` array.

- COLUMN_DATA_TYPE: Selects the `DataType` field of each element of the `Columns` array.

- COLUMN_COLUMN_TYPE: Selects the `ColumnType` field of each element of the `Columns` array.

- COLUMN_PROPERTIES: Selects the `Properties` field of each element of the `Columns` array.

- CREATED_AT: Selects the `CreatedAt` field.

- METADATA_MODIFIED_AT: Selects the `MetadataModifiedAt` field.

- METADATA_REVISION: Selects the `MetadataRevision` field.

- NAME: Selects the `Name` field.

- PROPERTIES: Selects the `Properties` field.

- ROW_COUNT: Selects the `RowCount` field.

- ROWS_MODIFIED_AT: Selects the `RowsModifiedAt` field.

- SUPPORTS_APPEND: Selects the `SupportsAppend` field.

- TEST_RESULT_ID: Selects the `TestResultId` field. Added in version 2 of the `listTables` operation.

- WORKSPACE: Selects the `Workspace` field.

projection.description:
The list of fields to return for each table in the response. When not specified, all
fields are returned. When empty, only table IDs are returned. When specifying both
`orderBy` and `projection`, the `orderBy` field must be included in the `projection` list.

take.description: Limits the returned list to the specified number of results.

continuationToken.description:
A token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching results. When
querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued. To obtain the next page of results,
pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation
token. To paginate results, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided
by the service, until this value is null.

orderBy.description:
The sort order of the returned list of tables. By default, tables are sorted in ascending order based on the specified value.
When specifying both `orderBy` and `projection`, the `orderBy` field must be included in the `projection` list:

- CREATED_AT: The date and time the table was created (default oldest table first).

- METADATA_MODIFIED_AT: The date and time the table's metadata properties were modified.

- NAME: The table's name, which defaults to the table's ID if a name is not provided.

- NUMBER_OF_ROWS: The number of rows of data in the table (default least number of rows first).

- ROWS_MODIFIED_AT: Date and time rows were most recently appended to the table.

orderByDescending.description:
Whether to sort descending instead of ascending. The elements in the list are sorted ascending by default.
If the orderByDescending parameter is specified, the elements in the list are sorted based on it's value.
The orderByDescending value must be a boolean string. The elements in the list are sorted ascending if false
and descending if true.

interactive.description:
Whether the query is being made within an interactive context, such as a web UI.
Interactive queries receive faster feedback for slow queries.

QueryTablesRequest.description: The parameters for querying the tables.

version.description: The implementation version of the web service.

StringColumnFilter.title: Column Filter

column.description: The name of the column to use for filtering.

operation.description:
How to compare the column's value with the specified `value` property. An error
is returned if the column's data type does not support the specified operation:
            
- String columns only support `EQUALS`, `NOT_EQUALS`, `CONTAINS`, and `NOT_CONTAINS`.
            
- Non-string columns do not support `CONTAINS` or `NOT_CONTAINS`.
            
- When `value` is null, `operation` must be `EQUALS` or `NOT_EQUALS`.
            
- When `value` is `NaN` for a floating-point column, `operation` must be `NOT_EQUALS`.

value.description: The comparison value to use for filtering. An error will be returned if the value cannot be converted to the column's data type.

StringColumnFilter.description: A filter to apply to the table data.

StringColumnOrderBy.title: Column Order By

column.description: The name of the column to order by.

descending.description: Whether the ordering should be in descending order.

StringColumnOrderBy.description: Specifies a column to order by and the ordering direction.

StringDecimatedDataQueryRequest.title: Decimated DataFrame Query Request

columns.description:
The names of columns to include in the response.
The response will include the columns in the same order specified in this parameter.
All columns are included in the order specified at table creation if this property is excluded.

filters.description:
A list of columns to filter by.
Only rows whose columns contain values matching all of the specified filters are returned.
The columns used for filtering do not need to be included in the `columns` list,
in which case they are not returned in the response.
These filters are applied before data is decimated.

StringDecimatedDataQueryRequest.description: Specifies the columns, filters and decimation parameters for a query.

StringDecimationOptions.title: Decimation Options

xColumn.description:
The name of the column that will be used as the x-axis for decimating the data.
The column in the table that was specified as Index will be used if this property is excluded.
Only numeric columns are supported. i.e. `INT32`, `INT64`, `FLOAT32`, `FLOAT64` and `TIMESTAMP`.

yColumns.description:
A list of columns to decimate by.
This property is only needed when the specified `method` is `MAX_MIN` or `ENTRY_EXIT`.
Only numeric columns are supported. i.e. `INT32`, `INT64`, `FLOAT32`, `FLOAT64` and `TIMESTAMP`.

intervals.description: Number of intervals to use for decimation.

method.description:
Specifies the method used to decimate the data:

- LOSSY: Creates an `xColumn` ordered set and returns an uniformly distributed sample of
rows with as many rows as the number specified as `intervals`.

- MAX_MIN: Creates an `xColumn` ordered set which will be divided in the number of `intervals` specified.
For each of the intervals, the maximum and minimum values for all the
columns specified in `yColumns` will be returned.

- ENTRY_EXIT: Creates an `xColumn` ordered set which will be divided in the number of `intervals` specified.
For each of the intervals, the first and last row within the interval will be returned
in addition to the maximum and minimum values for all the columns specified in `yColumns`.

StringDecimationOptions.description: Contains the parameters to use for data decimation.

StringExportTableDataRequest.title: Export Table Data Request

columns.description: The names of columns to include in the export. The export will include the columns in the same order specified in this parameter. All columns are included in the order specified at table creation if this property is excluded.

orderBy.description: A list of columns to order the results by. Multiple columns may be specified to order rows that have the same value for prior columns. The columns used for sorting do not need to be included in the columns list, in which case they are not included in the export.

filters.description: A list of columns to filter by. Only rows whose columns contain values matching all of the specified filters are returned. The columns used for filtering do not need to be included in the columns list, in which case they are not included in the export.

take.description: The maximum number of rows to include in the export. If not specified, all rows are included.

destination.description:
The destination of the exported data:

- INLINE: Returns the exported data as the body of the response.

- DOWNLOAD_LINK: Creates a one-time download URL for executing an export as a file download. Make a `GET` request to the URL returned
in the `Location` response header to retrieve the requested export data.

responseFormat.description:
The format of the exported data. The only response format currently supported is `CSV`:

- CSV: Comma-separated values.

StringExportTableDataRequest.description: Specifies the parameters for a data export with ordering and filtering.

StringQueryTableDataRequest.title: Query Table Data Request

columns.description: The names of columns to include in the response. The response will include the columns in the same order specified in this parameter. All columns are included in the order specified at table creation if this property is excluded.

orderBy.description: A list of columns to order the results by. Multiple columns may be specified to order rows that have the same value for prior columns. The columns used for sorting do not need to be included in the `columns` list, in which case they are not returned in the response. If orderBy is not specified, then the order in which results are returned is undefined.

filters.description: A list of columns to filter by. Only rows whose columns contain values matching all of the specified filters are returned. The columns used for filtering do not need to be included in the `columns` list, in which case they are not returned in the response.

take.description: Limits the returned list to the specified number of results. Use with the continuationToken property to implement pagination.

continuationToken.description:
A token which allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching results. When
querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued. To obtain the next page of results,
pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation
token. To paginate results, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided
by the service, until this value is null.

StringQueryTableDataRequest.description: Specifies the ordering and filtering query.

TableMetadataModification.title: Table Metadata Modification

id.description: The ID of the table to modify.

metadataRevision.description:
When specified, this is an integer that must match the last known revision number of the table,
incremented by one. If it doesn't match the current `metadataRevision` incremented by one at the
time of execution, the modify request will be rejected with a conflict error. This is used to
ensure that changes to this table's metadata are based on a known, previous state.

name.description: The new name of the table.

testResultId.description:
The new test result ID associated with the table. Set to an empty string to remove the
test result ID. Added in version 2 of the `modifyMetadata` operation.

workspace.description:
The new workspace for the table. Changing the workspace requires permission to delete the
table in its current workspace and permission to create the table in its new workspace.

properties.description:
The properties to modify. A map of key value properties containing the metadata to be added or
modified. Set a property value to `null` to delete that property. Existing properties not
included in the map are unaffected unless `replace` is `true` in the top-level request object.

TableMetadataModification.description:
Contains the modifications for a table's metadata. Values not included in the request body
or included with a `null` value will remain unchanged.

V1Operations.description: The operations available in the routes provided by the `/v1` HTTP API.
